### Problem 2

Let's import and tidy the data.

```{r import_tidy}
long_study_files = list.files(path = ".", pattern = "\\.csv$", full.names = TRUE)

long_study_df =
  long_study_files |> 
  map_df(~{
    read.csv(.x)  |> 
      janitor::clean_names()  |> 
      mutate(
        subject_id = as.numeric(str_extract(.x, "\\d+")),
        arm = ifelse(grepl("con", .x), "Control", "Experimental")
      )  |> 
      pivot_longer(
        cols = starts_with("week_"),
        names_to = "week", 
        values_to = "observation"
      )  |> 
      select(subject_id, arm, everything())
  })
```

Let's make a spaghetti plot.
```{r spaghetti}
long_study_df |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = week, y = observation, color = arm, group = subject_id)) +
  geom_line() +
  labs(title = "Spaghetti Plot of Observations Over Time",
       x = "Week",
       y = "Observation")
```
